trans-unit.source: Animates the value of a property that takes a <xref href="System.Boolean"></xref> along a set of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.BooleanAnimationUsingKeyFrames.KeyFrames"></xref> over a specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline.Duration"></xref>.

A key frame animation's target values are defined by its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.BooleanAnimationUsingKeyFrames.KeyFrames%2A> property, which contains a collection of <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.BooleanKeyFrame> objects.

Each <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.BooleanKeyFrame> defines a segment of the animation with its own target <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.BooleanKeyFrame.Value%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.BooleanKeyFrame.KeyTime%2A>.
When the animation runs, it progresses from one key value to the next at the specified key times.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.BooleanAnimationUsingKeyFrames"></xref> class.
Adds a child <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.BooleanKeyFrame"></xref> to this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.BooleanAnimationUsingKeyFrames"></xref>.
This method allows <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.BooleanKeyFrame> objects to be direct children of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.BooleanAnimationUsingKeyFrames> object in markup.
The object to be added as the child of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.BooleanAnimationUsingKeyFrames"></xref>.
The parameter child is not a .
Adds a text string as a child of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.BooleanAnimationUsingKeyFrames"></xref>.

A <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.BooleanAnimationUsingKeyFrames> does not accept text as a child, so this method will raise an `InvalididOperationException` unless a derived class has overridden this behavior which allows text to be added.
The text added to the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.BooleanAnimationUsingKeyFrames"></xref>.

A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.BooleanAnimationUsingKeyFrames"></xref> does not accept text as a child, so this method will raise this exception unless a derived class has overridden this behavior which allows text to be added.
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.BooleanAnimationUsingKeyFrames"></xref>, making deep copies of this object's values.
When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.
This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object).
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.Clone%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A modifiable clone of the current object.
The cloned object's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property will be `false` even if the source's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property was `true.`
Makes this instance a deep copy of the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.BooleanAnimationUsingKeyFrames"></xref>.
When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.

This method is called by the <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.Clone%2A> method and should not be called directly from your code, except when calling the base implementation while overriding this method.
To create a modifiable copy of the current object, call <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.Clone%2A> instead of calling this method directly.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.CloneCore%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.BooleanAnimationUsingKeyFrames"></xref> to clone.
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.BooleanAnimationUsingKeyFrames"></xref> object, making deep copies of this object's current values.
Resource references, data bindings, and animations are not copied, but their current values are.
This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object).
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.CloneCurrentValue%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A modifiable clone of the current object.
The cloned object's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property will be `false` even if the source's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property was `true`.
Makes this instance a modifiable deep copy of the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.BooleanAnimationUsingKeyFrames"></xref> using current property values.
Resource references, data bindings, and animations are not copied, but their current values are.

This method is called by the <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.CloneCurrentValue%2A> method and should not be called directly from your code, except when calling the base implementation while overriding this method.
To create a modifiable copy of the current object, call <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.CloneCurrentValue%2A> instead of calling this method directly.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.CloneCurrentValueCore%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.BooleanAnimationUsingKeyFrames"></xref> to be cloned.
Creates a new instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.BooleanAnimationUsingKeyFrames"></xref>.
A new instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.BooleanAnimationUsingKeyFrames"></xref>.
Makes this instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.BooleanAnimationUsingKeyFrames"></xref> object unmodifiable or determines whether it can be made unmodifiable..
`true` if this method should simply determine whether this instance can be frozen.
`false` if this instance should actually freeze itself when this method is called.
If isChecking is true, this method returns `true` if this object can be made read-only, or `false` if it cannot be made read-only.

If isChecking is false, this method returns `true` if this object is now read-only, or `false` if it cannot be made read-only, with the side effect of having begun to change the frozen status of this object.
Makes this instance a clone of the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.BooleanAnimationUsingKeyFrames"></xref> object.
When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.

Note that if these properties contain resource references or data bindings, <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.GetAsFrozen%2A> will fail when trying to freeze the object and will throw an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException>.

This method is called by the <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.GetAsFrozen%2A> method and should not be called directly from your code, except when calling the base implementation while overriding this method.
To create a frozen copy of the current object, call <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.GetAsFrozen%2A> instead of calling this method directly.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.GetAsFrozenCore%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.BooleanAnimationUsingKeyFrames"></xref> object to be cloned.
Makes this instance a frozen clone of the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.BooleanAnimationUsingKeyFrames"></xref>.
Resource references, data bindings, and animations are not copied, but their current values are.

This method is called by the <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.GetCurrentValueAsFrozen%2A> method and should not be called directly from your code, except when calling the base implementation while overriding this method.
To create a frozen copy of the current object, call <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.GetCurrentValueAsFrozen%2A> instead of calling this method directly.
For more information see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.GetCurrentValueAsFrozenCore%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.BooleanAnimationUsingKeyFrames"></xref> to copy and freeze.

Calculates a value that represents the current value of the property being animated, as determined by this instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.BooleanAnimationUsingKeyFrames"></xref>.

If the `defaultOriginValue` is the first in the composition chain, this value will be the snapshot value (if one is available) or the base property value; otherwise this value will be the value returned by the previous animation in the chain with an <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationClock> that is not <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Clock.Stopped%2A>.

The `defaultDestinationValue` is the base value if the animation is in the first composition layer of animations on a property; otherwise the value is the output value from the previous composition layer of animations for the property.
The suggested origin value, used if the animation does not have its own explicitly set start value.
The suggested destination value, used if the animation does not have its own explicitly set end value.

An <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationClock"></xref> that generates the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.Clock.CurrentTime"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.Clock.CurrentProgress"></xref> used by the host animation.
The calculated value of the property, as determined by the current instance.
Provide a custom natural <xref href="System.Windows.Duration"></xref> when the <xref href="System.Windows.Duration"></xref> property is set to <xref href="System.Windows.Duration.Automatic"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.Clock"></xref> whose natural duration is desired.

If the last key frame of this animation is a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.KeyTime"></xref>, then this value is used as the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.Clock.NaturalDuration"></xref>; otherwise it will be one second.
Gets or sets the collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.BooleanKeyFrame"></xref> objects that define the animation.
The collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.BooleanKeyFrame"></xref> objects that define the animation.
The default value is <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.BooleanKeyFrameCollection.Empty"></xref>.
Called when the current <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.BooleanAnimationUsingKeyFrames"></xref> object is modified.

Returns true if the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.BooleanAnimationUsingKeyFrames.KeyFrames"></xref> property of this instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.BooleanAnimationUsingKeyFrames"></xref> should be value-serialized.
`true` if the property value should be serialized; otherwise, `false`.
Adds a child object.
The child object to add.
Adds the text content of a node to the object.
The text to add to the object.
Gets or sets an ordered collection P:System.Windows.Media.Animation.IKeyFrameAnimation.KeyFrames associated with this animation sequence.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref> of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.IKeyFrameAnimation.KeyFrames"></xref>.
